core-concepts/circuit-composition.title: Circuit Composition
core-concepts/circuit-composition.description: Circuit composition is a fundamental concept in quantum computing that enables building complex quantum algorithms from simpler components. HaskQ provides elegant ways to compose quantum circuits using Haskell's functional programming paradigm.

core-concepts/linear-types.title: Linear Types in Quantum Computing
core-concepts/linear-types.description: HaskQ leverages GHC's LinearTypes extension to enforce the no-cloning theorem of quantum mechanics. This document explains what linear types are, why they're essential for quantum programming, and how to use them effectively in HaskQ.

core-concepts/measurement.title: Measurement and Classical Control
core-concepts/measurement.description: Measurement is a fundamental operation in quantum computing that bridges the quantum and classical worlds. This document explains how measurement works in HaskQ and how to use measurement results to control classical operations.

core-concepts/quantum-computing-basics.title: Quantum Computing Basics
core-concepts/quantum-computing-basics.description: This document provides a brief introduction to the fundamental concepts of quantum computing.

core-concepts/quantum-gates.title: Quantum Gates
core-concepts/quantum-gates.description: In quantum computing, gates are the fundamental building blocks for quantum circuits, similar to how logic gates are used in classical computing. This guide explores the quantum gates implemented in HaskQ.

core-concepts/simulation.title: Quantum Simulation
core-concepts/simulation.description: HaskQ includes a powerful quantum circuit simulator that allows you to test and analyze quantum algorithms without a physical quantum computer. This document explains how simulation works in HaskQ and how to use it effectively.

getting-started.title: Getting Started with HaskQ
getting-started.description: This guide will help you get started with HaskQ, from installation to creating your first quantum circuit.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: This guide covers how to install and set up HaskQ on your system.

intro.title: Introduction to HaskQ
intro.description: Welcome to HaskQ, a quantum computing framework built in Haskell that combines the elegance of functional programming with the power of quantum computing.

playground.title: HaskQ Playground
playground.description: The HaskQ Playground is an interactive environment where you can write, test, and visualize quantum circuits directly in your browser.

project-structure.title: Project Structure
project-structure.description: Understanding the structure of the HaskQ project will help you navigate the codebase and contribute effectively.

tutorials/algorithms.title: Quantum Algorithms in HaskQ
tutorials/algorithms.description: This page contains examples of quantum algorithms implemented in HaskQ.

tutorials/bell-states.title: Creating Bell States
tutorials/bell-states.description: This tutorial guides you through creating a Bell state, one of the fundamental entangled quantum states, using HaskQ.

tutorials/error-correction.title: Error Correction in HaskQ
tutorials/error-correction.description: This page explains how to implement error correction codes in HaskQ.

tutorials/fault-tolerance.title: Fault Tolerance
tutorials/fault-tolerance.description: This page explains how to implement fault-tolerant quantum computing in HaskQ.

tutorials/hybrid-algorithms.title: Hybrid Quantum-Classical Algorithms
tutorials/hybrid-algorithms.description: This page explains how to implement hybrid quantum-classical algorithms in HaskQ.

tutorials/noise-models.title: Quantum Noise Models
tutorials/noise-models.description: This page explains how to simulate quantum noise in HaskQ.

tutorials/optimization.title: Circuit Optimization
tutorials/optimization.description: This page explains how to optimize quantum circuits in HaskQ.

tutorials/surface-codes.title: Surface Codes
tutorials/surface-codes.description: This page explains how to implement surface code error correction in HaskQ.
